remarks: Lemma for ~ chebbnd1 : show a lower bound on ` ppi ( x ) ` at even integers using similar techniques to those used to prove ~ bpos .  (Note that the expression ` K ` is actually equal to ` 2 x. N ` , but proving that is not necessary for the proof, and it's too much work.)  The key to the proof is ~ bposlem1 , which shows that each term in the expansion ` ( ( 2 x. N ) _C N ) = prod_ p e. Prime ` ` ( p ^ ( p pCnt ( ( 2 x. N ) _C N ) ) ) ` is at most ` 2 x. N ` , so that the sum really only has nonzero elements up to ` 2 x. N ` , and since each term is at most ` 2 x. N ` , after taking logs we get the inequality ` ppi ( 2 x. N ) x. log ( 2 x. N ) <_ ` ` log ( ( 2 x. N ) _C N ) ` , and ~ bclbnd finishes the proof. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Apr-2016.)
